The election day for a possible second election (second round) will be 11 February 2024, and advance voting abroad will be possible from 31 January to 3 February 2024.

83.Title: Malta’s residential property prices continue to rise (2023, Q3)
83.Snippet: Malta’s residential property price growth continues, despite a temporary slowdown in demand. During the year to Q2 2023, the nationwide property price index rose by 8.3% (2.01% inflation-adjusted), following year-on-year increases of 10.51% in Q1 2023, 2.71% in Q4 2022, 5.16% in Q3 2022, 1.71% in Q2 2022, and 1.66% in Q1 2022, according to the Central Bank of Malta.

99.Title: Malta - Parliamentary Democracy, Multiculturalism, Mediterranean
99.Snippet: Malta - Parliamentary Democracy, Multiculturalism, Mediterranean: The 1964 constitution, under which Malta became an independent monarchy and parliamentary state, was amended in 1974 to make Malta a republic within the Commonwealth. Malta is currently a unitary multiparty republic. The Maltese parliament consists of a unicameral House of Representatives and is fashioned on the British model.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Maltese presidential election is set to take place on November 5, 2024 (12). The incumbent Democratic President Joe Biden has announced he will not be seeking re-election (9,19) and has endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris as his successor (10). The election is expected to be a historic one, with former President Donald Trump (12) announcing his candidacy for the Republican nomination (8). Other candidates include a Republican nominee and former President (12), and the head of the world's third-largest democracy (14). The election will also coincide with Malta's seat on the UN Security Council (15).
